docs.snippet: If you’re still receiving “Welcome back to Facebook” messages, you may not have fully closed your account on the social network.

headline.print_headline: You Dumped Facebook. So Why Does It Keep Sending You Emails?
headline.main: You Dumped Facebook. So Why Does It Keep Sending You Emails?

docs.snippet: The move comes a week after two leaders were convicted of hate crimes and months after the president elevated their inflammatory views on Twitter.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Blocks Britain First, a Far-Right Anti-Muslim Group Promoted by Trump
headline.main: Facebook Blocks Britain First, a Far-Right Anti-Muslim Group Promoted by Trump

docs.snippet: The company’s board said it was suspending the chief executive, Alexander Nix, with immediate effect, pending an independent investigation.

headline.main: Cambridge Analytica Suspends C.E.O. Amid Facebook Data Scandal

docs.snippet: There are some practical solutions to safeguard some of your data, like installing software to block web tracking technologies.

headline.print_headline: Taking Practical Steps To Protect Your Data  From Harvesters
headline.main: How to Protect Yourself (and Your Friends) on Facebook

docs.snippet: In 2011, the F.T.C. first required a company to create a comprehensive data privacy program for consumers. Europe will soon take another big step.

headline.print_headline: Feeling Regulators’ Glare  On Both Sides of the Atlantic
headline.main: Timeline: Facebook and Google Under Regulators’ Glare

docs.snippet: Cambridge Analytica harvested personal information from a huge swath of the electorate to develop techniques that were later used in the Trump campaign.

headline.print_headline: Firm That Assisted Trump Exploited Data of Millions
headline.main: How Trump Consultants Exploited the Facebook Data of Millions

docs.snippet: American and British lawmakers called on Facebook to explain how a political data firm tied to the Trump campaign harvested private data from more than 50 million users.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Role In Data Misuse  Sets Off Storm
headline.main: Facebook’s Role in Data Misuse Sets Off Storms on Two Continents

docs.snippet: Fair housing advocates sued Facebook Tuesday, saying it lets landlords and real estate brokers target advertising to discriminate against women, those with disabilities and families with children.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Sued by Housing Advocates Alleging Discrimination
headline.main: Facebook Sued by Housing Advocates Alleging Discrimination

docs.snippet: Internet companies were built on a model in which people gave up their information for free services. Now, that idea is under siege.

headline.print_headline: Call for Privacy Hands a Crisis To Tech Giants
headline.main: How Calls for Privacy May Upend Business for Facebook and Google

docs.snippet: Facebook's CEO apologized for the Cambridge Analytica scandal with ads in multiple U.S. and British newspapers Sunday, saying the social media platform doesn't deserve to hold personal information if it can't protect it.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Ads Apologize for Cambridge Analytica Scandal
headline.main: Facebook Ads Apologize for Cambridge Analytica Scandal
